sentences.en: "Move!" she cried. "Don't be so darn poky!"
sentences.cn: “动起来！”她叫道：“别这么慢吞吞的！”

sentences.en: Darn it! She beat me again!
sentences.cn: 倒霉! 她又比我强了!

sentences.en: Grandmother used to darn her own stockings.
sentences.cn: 祖母过去总是自己织补袜子.

sentences.en: Her cardigan had been darned at the elbows.
sentences.cn: 她的羊毛衫肘部缝补过。

sentences.en: I know how to darn, and how to sew a button on.
I must darn the hole in my pocket.
Mary: Oh, darn it I thought I was still in Palm Springs.
sentences.cn: 玛丽: 噢, 该死,我以为我还在棕榈泉呢.

sentences.en: OK, I admit it, it was me. But darn it, I was right!
sentences.cn: 好吧，我承认，是我干的。但我是对的，可恶！

sentences.en: Please darn the hole in my sock.
sentences.cn: 请缝补一下我袜子上的小洞.

sentences.en: That darn ( ed ) cat has eaten my supper!
sentences.cn: 这个死猫把我的晚饭吃掉了!

sentences.en: There's not a darn thing he can do about it.
We start working pretty darn early.
sentences.cn: 我们一大早就开始工作。

sentences.en: What a darn ( ed ) stupid thing to say!
sentences.cn: 这话说得多 麽 愚蠢!

sentences.en: Why don't you switch the darn thing off and listen to me!
sentences.cn: 把那讨厌的东西关掉，专心听我讲话好不好！

words.tran_cn: 岂有此理的；可恨的；该死的
可恨地；岂有此理地（damned的委婉表达）
缝补台；缝补针；缝补的人
织补（darn的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_en: a patch of darned work on a garment
to repair a hole in a piece of clothing by stitching wool over it
